
Two users reused a prime when generating their RSA keys. An intercepted message is: 485488018081499750797384478506942669394088630616888590375723543896789714833055586441796622907197302133415710513224875257840037492382725378590433431540155481445382927604888775576656234519479449564666330743106016797507966537118222527. Can you recover the plaintext?

## Challenge Technical Details

cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 485488018081499750797384478506942669394088630616888590375723543896789714833055586441796622907197302133415710513224875257840037492382725378590433431540155481445382927604888775576656234519479449564666330743106016797507966537118222527

hint: When two RSA moduli share a common prime, computing GCD(n, n2) can reveal the shared prime factor.
